intro: Mascarenhasia lisianthiflora subsp. geayi, commonly known as the Mascarene starflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Mascarene Islands. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
